section.title: File Definition
section.p: A file is considered to be a DocBook 4 document when one of the following conditions are true:

ul.li: The root element name is book or article.
The PUBLIC ID of the document contains the string -//OASIS//DTD DocBook XML.

section.title: Default Document Templates
section.p: There are a variety of default DocBook 4 templates available when creating new documents from templatesnew documents from templates, including Article, Book, Chapter, Glossary, Section, and more.
The default templates for DocBook 4 documents are located in the /frameworks/docbook/templates/Docbook 4 folder.

section.title: Default Schema
section.p: The default schema that is used if one is not detected in the DocBook 4 file is docbookxi.dtd and it is stored in /frameworks/docbook/4.5/dtd/.

section.title: Default CSS
section.p: The default CSS files used for rendering DocBook content in Author mode are stored in /frameworks/docbook/css/.
By default, these default CSS files are merged with any that are specified in the document. For more information, see .

section.title: Default XML Catalog
section.p: The default XML catalog, catalog.xml, is stored in /frameworks/docbook/.
